Description:
You can use the search interaction to query for medication orders based on a patient and optionally status or category.

This resource can return various types of medications, including prescriptions, inpatient-ordered medications, and clinic-administered medications (CAMS).

The STU3 version of this resource does not return patient-reported medications. To report on patient-reported medications use the STU3 MedicationStatement resource or R4 MedicationRequest resource.

Starting in February 2022 or November 2021 by special update, organizations in the Netherlands can use this resource to satisfy the requirements of the MedicationAgreement profile.

authoredon.Name: authoredon
authoredon.Description: This parameter is allowed, but ignored.

category.Name: category
category.Description:
The category of medication orders to search for. By default all categories are searched.


Supported categories:

  • inpatient
  • outpatient
  • community
  • patientspecified

patient.Name: patient
patient.Description: The FHIR Patient ID. Either this element or Subject is required.

status.Name: status
status.Description:
The status for medication orders. By default, active is assumed. Active must be present in all searches (i.e. you cannot search for just completed meds).


Supported statuses:

  • On-hold
  • Completed
  • Stopped
  • Active

subject.Name: subject
subject.Description: The FHIR patient ID. Either this element or Patient is required.

Bundle.Name: Bundle
Bundle.Description: Resource bundle. For more information, refer to the FHIR specification.

entry.Name: entry
entry.Description: A single entry in the resource bundle.

resource.Name: resource
resource.Description: A single resource returned as part of this bundle.

authoredOn.Name: authoredOn
authoredOn.Description: The date the prescription was written.

category.Name: category
category.Description:
Type of medication usage. There are three categories:


  • Inpatient
  • Outpatient (those administered in the clinic - CAMS)
  • Community (prescriptions)
  • SNOMED code 16076005 (prescription, Netherlands environments only

additionalInstruction.Name: additionalInstruction
additionalInstruction.Description:
Administration instructions for the medication.

Available starting in February 2022 and in November 2021 by special update.

doseQuantity.Name: doseQuantity
doseQuantity.Description: Amount of medication per dose. The amount of therapeutic or other substance given at one administration event.

extension.Name: extension
extension.Description: The ordered dose and administered amount.

valueQuantity.Name: extension
valueQuantity.Description: A valueQuantity object containing the administered amount.

valueQuantity.Name: extension
valueQuantity.Description: A valueQuantity object containing the ordered dose.

patientInstruction.Name: patientInstruction
patientInstruction.Description:
The patient instructions for the prescription.

For a multi-line sig, this is the same.

rateQuantity.Name: rateQuantity
rateQuantity.Description:
Amount of medication per unit of time. Used when the rate is a discrete value.

Available starting in February 2022 and in November 2021 by special update.

rateRange.Name: rateRange
rateRange.Description:
Amount of medication per unit of time. Used when the rate is a range.

Available starting in February 2022 and in November 2021 by special update.

sequence.Name: sequence
sequence.Description: This element is populated only for multi-line sigs.

text.Name: text
text.Description:
The patient instructions for the prescription.

For a multi-line sig, this is the same.

repeat.Name: repeat
repeat.Description: Element indicating an event that occurs multiple times.

boundsPeriod.Name: boundsPeriod
boundsPeriod.Description: The start and end dates for the medication.

count.Name: count
count.Description: If the medication is not PRN, and CountType is Doses, this element is populated with the count value.

countMax.Name: countMax
countMax.Description: If the medication is PRN, this element is set to Count.

groupIdentifier.Name: groupIdentifier
groupIdentifier.Description: The group ID and index for linked orders.

medicationCodeableConcept.Name: medicationCodeableConcept
medicationCodeableConcept.Description: If OrderedMedicationId is empty, this field is sent instead of medicationReference.

medicationReference.Name: medicationReference
medicationReference.Description: The FHIR ID representation of the ordered medication.

periodOfUse.Name: extension
periodOfUse.Description: The period during which a medication was used.

priorPrescription.Name: priorPrescription
priorPrescription.Description: The ID of the order from which this order was reordered.

requester.Name: requester
requester.Description: The provider ID. Otherwise, the user ID.

status.Name: status
status.Description: The status of the medication request.

stopType.Name: modifierExtension
stopType.Description: Indicates whether the stopping of a medication is permanent or temporary. This element is meant for organizations in the Netherlands only.

subject.Name: subject
subject.Description: Who the medication request is for.

allowed.Name: allowed
allowed.Description:
If the Dispense as Written item is set to 1, we return this as No.

If Dispense as Written does not equal 1, we don't return a substitution element.

supportingInformation.Name: supportingInformation
supportingInformation.Description: This element is used for linked orders.
